      • addParam

        public static java.lang.String addParam(java.lang.String key,
                                        java.lang.String data)
        For parameters to be passed in the URL of a GET or POST request, they must be in the form of: = where is replaced with the key for the path parameter and is the information being passed by the path parameter the '&' is being passed so that multiple path parameters can be concatenated to be passed together
        Parameters:
        key - name of the parameter being passed
        data - value being passed
        Returns:
        string that can be concatenated to the URL used for the request

      • validateLoginInfo

        public boolean validateLoginInfo(java.lang.String username,
                                 java.lang.String password,
                                 java.lang.String email)
        This method validates whether or not a username, password, and email are in a valid form to have an account created from them. Through the utilization of regular expressions, the form of each piece of the given user credentials meets our specifications.
        Specified by:
        validateLoginInfo in interface DBLoginInterface
        Parameters:
        username -
        password -
        email -
        Returns:
